intro: Rubus consobrinus, commonly known as the Mexican blackberry, is a species of brambles native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Rubus consobrinus is often found in forest understories and along stream banks.
